hillbillies.model

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    A class describing the World in which the game is played, containing a TerrainChangeListener, a 3D array which describes the terrain, a ConnectedToBorder object, a set of Units, a set of Factions, a set of Boulders and a set of Logs.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kevin Algoet & Jeroen Depuydt
    Invariants:
  • The TerrainChangeListener of each World must be a valid TerrainChangeListener for any World.
  • Each World must have proper Units.
  • Each World must have proper Factions.
  • Each World must have proper Logs.
  • Each World must have proper Boulders.
  • The terrain of each World must be a valid terrain for any World.
    • Note:
    Repository link: https://github.com/KivinA/ProjectOGP

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int[][][] terrain,
             TerrainChangeListener modelListener)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this new World with the given terrainTypes and TerrainChangeListener.
        Parameters:
        terrainTypes - The terrainTypes for this new World.
        modelListener - The TerrainChangeListener for this new World.
        Postconditions:
      • The TerrainChangeListener of this new World is equal to the given modelListener.
      • The terrain of this World is initialized as a new 3D array with the corresponding lengths of the given 3D array terrain.
      • The connectedToBorderObject is initialized as a new ConnectedToBorder with the number of x, y and z cubes.
        • Effect:
        Initialize the terrain of this World according to the given terrain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given TerrainChangeListener is invalid for any World.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given terrain is invalid for any World.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an exception was thrown.

        Parameters:
        modelListener - The TerrainChangeListener to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given TerrainChangeListener is effective.

        @Raw
public boolean isConnectedToBorder(int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int z)
        Check whether the given cube is attached to the borders of this World.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cube to check.
        y - The y coordinate of the cube to check.
        z - The z coordinate of the cube to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given cube is indeed connected to one of the borders of this World.

      • hasSolidNeighbouringCube

        @Raw
public boolean hasSolidNeighbouringCube(int x,
                                              int y,
                                              int z)
        Check whether the given cube has a solid neighbouring cube.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cube to check.
        y - The y coordinate of the cube to check.
        z - The z coordinate of the cube to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if one of the neigbouring cubes (X+- 0..1, Y+- 0..1, Z+- 0..1) is solid.

      • isBetweenBoundaries

        @Raw
public boolean isBetweenBoundaries(int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int z)
        Check whether the given cube is between the boundaries of this World.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cube to check.
        y - The y coordinate of the cube to check.
        z - The z coordinate of the cube to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if each coordinate is between the lower boundary and amount of cubes of this dimension (which is the upper boundary).

      • isPassableCube

        @Raw
public boolean isPassableCube(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int z)
        Check if the given cube is passable.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cube to check.
        y - The y coordinate of the cube to check.
        z - The z coordinate of the cube to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the cube type of the given cube type is equal to 0 (air) or 3 (workshop).

      • isSolidCube

        public boolean isSolidCube(int x,
                           int y,
                           int z)
        Check if the given cube is solid.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cube to check.
        y - The y coordinate of the cube to check.
        z - The z coordinate of the cube to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the cube type of the given cube is either equal to 1 (rock) or 2 (tree).

        Convert the given precise double coordinates to integer cube coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The double coordinates to convert.
        Returns:
        An ineffective array if the given array is ineffective.
        Returns:
        An integer array containing the x, y, z cube coordinates according to the given double precise coordinates.

        public static double[] getPreciseCoordinates(int[] coordinates)
        Convert the given integer cube coordinates to precise double coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The integer coordinates to convert.
        Returns:
        An ineffective array if the given array is ineffective.
        Returns:
        A double array containing the precise x, y, z coordinates according to the given integer coordinates.

      • isNeighbouringCube

        public static boolean isNeighbouringCube(int[] originalCube,
                                         int[] neighbourCube)
        Check whether the given cube is a neighbour of a given original cube.
        Parameters:
        originalCube - The original cube to check the neighbour cube with.
        neighbourCube - The cube to check if its a neighbouring cube of the original cube.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given neighbour cube is a neighbouring cube of the original cube. This means the coordinates components of the neighbouring cube are either the original cube components +1, -1 or if the neighbouring cube components are equal to the original cube components.

        z - The z coordinate of the given cube to set the cube type.
        value - The given value to set as the cube type of the given cube.
        Postcondition:
        The cubeType of the given cube is set to the given value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given cube is out of bounds.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given value is invalid for any cube.

      • addUnit

        @Raw
public void addUnit(@Raw
                          Unit unit)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Add the given Unit to this World.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to add to this World.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of Units of this World is incremented by 1.
      • This World has the given Unit as one of its Units.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This World cannot have the given Unit as one of its Units.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The maximum amount of Units has been reached.

                                     Unit unit)

        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Unit is effective, if this World has the given Unit as one of its Units and if the given Unit is dead.

      • removeUnit

        @Raw
public void removeUnit(@Raw
                             Unit unit)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove the given Unit from this World.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to remove.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of Units of this World is decremented by 1.
      • This World no longer has the given Unit as one of its Units.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This World cannot remove the given Unit from its Units.

      • hasProperUnits

        public boolean hasProperUnits()
        Check whether this World has proper Units attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this World can have each Unit as one of its Units and if each Unit references this World as the World to which they are attached.

      • getAllUnits

        @Basic
 @Raw
public java.util.Set<Unit> getAllUnits()
        Return a set containing all the Units of this World.
        Returns:
        The resulting set is effective.
        Returns:
        The number of elements in the resulting set is equal to the number of Units attached to this World.
        Returns:
        Each element of the resulting set equals a Unit that is attached to this World.

      • spawnUnit

        public Unit spawnUnit(boolean enableDefaultBehaviour)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      ModelException
        Spawn a new Unit with random initial attributes at a random position of the World. Initial positions shall be chosen such that a new Unit is occupying a passable cube at (x, y, z), where (x, y, z - 1) must be a solid cube or z = 0.
        Effects:
      • A new Unit is created with a random strength, agility, toughness, weight, valid position, name, a default behaviour state and this World as its World.
      • The newly created Unit is added to this World's Units.
      • If the amount of Factions is lower than the maximum amount of Factions, a new Faction is created and this Faction is added to this World's Factions.
      • If a new Faction is added, this new Unit is added to the created Faction. Otherwise, the Unit is added to the Faction with the least amount of Units.
      • Set the faction of this newly created Unit to the Faction that has added this Unit.
        • Returns:
        The new Unit that has been created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The maximum amount of Units has been reached.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.
        ModelException - // TODO FUCKING DELETE THIS The amount of Units exceeds the maximum amount of Units.

        public boolean canHaveAsWorldObject(WorldObject object)
        Check whether the given WorldObject is a valid WorldObject for any World.
        Parameters:
        object - The WorldObject to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given WorldObject is effective and if the given WorldObject isn't terminated

      • addWorldObject

        public void addWorldObject(WorldObject object)
        Add the given WorldObject (which is either a Log or Boulder) to their corresponding sets of this World.
        Parameters:
        object - The WorldObject to add.
        Postconditions:
      • If the given object is an instance of the Log class, then the World has the given object as one of its Logs.
      • If the given object is an instance of the Log class, then the number of Logs in this World is incremented by 1.
      • If the given object is an instance of the Boulder class, then this World has the given object as one of its Boulders.
      • If the given object is an instance of the Bouldr class, then the number of Boulders in this World is incremented by 1.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This World cannot have the given WorldObject as one of its logs or boulders.

      • canRemoveAsLog

        @Raw
public boolean canRemoveAsLog(Log log)
        Check whether this World can remove the given Log from its Logs.
        Parameters:
        log - The Log to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Log is valid, if the given Log is registered as one of the Logs of this World and if the given Log is terminated.

      • removeLog

        @Raw
public void removeLog(Log log)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove the given Log from this World's collection of Logs.
        Parameters:
        log - The Log to remove.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of Logs in this World is decremented by 1.
      • This World no longer has the given Log as one of its Logs.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This World cannot remove the given Log as one of its Logs.

      • hasProperLogs

        public boolean hasProperLogs()
        Check whether this World has proper Logs attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if each Log of this World is a valid Log for any World and if each Log references this World as the World to which they are attached.

      • spawnLog

        @Raw
public void spawnLog(double[] targetCube)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Spawn a new Log with a random weight in a given cube in this World.
        Parameters:
        targetCube - The given cube in which the new Log spawns.
        Effects:
      • If the given targetCube isn't passable, change the cube type to air.
      • Initialize a new Log with the given targetCube, a random weight and this World as its World.
      • Add this newly created Log to this World's collection of Logs.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given targetCube cannot be null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

        True if and only if each Boulder of this World is a valid Boulder for any World and if each Boulder references this World as the World to which they are attached.

      • spawnBoulder

        public void spawnBoulder(double[] targetCube)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Spawn a Boulder in a given cube in this World.
        Parameters:
        targetCube - The given cube in which the new Boulder spawns.
        Effects:
      • If the given targetCube isn't passable, change the cube type to air.
      • Initialize a new Boulder with the given targetCube, a random weight and this World as its World.
      • Add this newly created Boulder to this World's collection of Boulders.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given targetCube is ineffective.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.
